description.narrative: The Danish Egyptian Dialogue Institute is an intergovernmental organization which acts as a platform for intercultural dialogue, exchanges and cooperation. The Institute deals with identity and misunderstandings between Denmark and Egypt and between Europe and the Arab world in general and with the improvement of political and cultural life. The Foundation began its activities in 2005. It is managed by a board of three Egyptian and three Danish members who hires Director of the Institute, which is responsible for the Institute's daily operations. In view of the upheavals in the Arab spring 2011, the Board in 2011 adopted a new work plan for Dedis work, primarily to support the transition process. DEDI has a special focus on politics, culture and media. In the political field, focusing on the development of political parties, the promotion of active democratic citizenship and the development of local democracy and decentralization. In relation to the cultural field, the focus is on art and culture in the public space, and innovative approaches to culture that promotes inclusion, diversity and dialogue. On the media level organizes DEDI dialogue conferences for media organizations and people who will primarily deal with the relationship between media and society.
